Lab2

In this lab 2, I explored and experimented with headless CMS platforms like Strapi, Contentful, Sanity, Prismic, and Ghost. I tested a few systems, documented my findings, and explained my final choice for my project’s content management solution through screenshots, code samples, and detailed justification.

Published Date: November 09, 2024

Assignment1

this is the first assignment

Published Date: November 06, 2024

Slug: employeeDirectory
Lab1

In this lab write-up, I have documented my experience using Static Site Generation (SSG) and the benefits it offers in web development. SSG provides a way to pre-render web pages as static HTML files, making websites faster, more secure, and easier to host. To dive deeper into SSG, I explored various template engines, analyzed their pros and cons, and chose one to use for my assignment based on its ease of use. Additionally, I researched other popular SSG tools beyond Eleventy (11ty) to understand the broader landscape. For the assignment, I configured 11ty based on its documentation, applying specific settings to streamline my site’s structure and efficiency. Lastly, I researched about front matter to understand how it enhances content management in SSG by providing metadata that influences how pages are rendered and displayed. Through this ab research I gained a more thorough understanding of SSG and the practical aspects of implementing it in web projects.

Published Date: November 06, 2024

Slug: Lab1/lab1_Deliverable/
